Package chatclient

This package provides an interface and class for the client for a chat application.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ClientCallback
    This interface allows an implementing class to receive messages using RMI
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Client
    A class to instantiate a client for the chat server.

Package chatclient Description

This package provides an interface and class for the client for a chat application. The Client class implements a client for the Server. The client contains only its own name, a ChatServer object pointing to the server that it wants to interact with, and a ClientCallback object that acts as a stub pointing to itself. On logging in to the server, it give the server it's name and corresponding stub so the server can identify different clients by account name. As for the client itself, nearly all of its methods, such as Client.login(java.lang.String, java.lang.String) or Client.sendMessage(java.lang.String, java.lang.String), are just wrappers for RMI calls to server methods. The exception is Client.receiveMessage(java.lang.String), which the server calls for the correct client using the exported stub when the client is to receive a message. This then displays the message in the clients terminal.
